12 work along the bottom side of the left cup like this st row 1 ch3 2dc in 1 chain-space 2dc under each double_crochet/ch3 till the end of the cup next chain the number of sts that corresponds to your back width then continue along the bottom side of the right cup by doing 2dc under each double_crochet/ch3 of the cup finish with 1dc in the last st turn count the sts there should be an uneven number of sts if you have an even number of sts add 1 st in next row st row 2 single_crochet in 1 st ch3 sk1 single_crochet in next st ch3 repeat to the end of row finish with single_crochet in last st turn st st row 3 single_crochet in 1 st ch3 single_crochet in 1 chain-space ch3 single_crochet in next chain-space repeat to the last chain-space ch3 single_crochet in last chain-space ch1 half_double_crochet in last st turn row 4 ch3 single_crochet in next chain-space ch1 single_crochet in next chain- space repeat to the end of row finish with ch1 half_double_crochet in last st turn row 5 ch3 single_crochet in next chain-space single_crochet in next single_crochet single_crochet in next chain-space repeat to the end of row finish with a single_crochet in last chain- space turn row 6 single_crochet in each st to the end of row turn repeat row 2 to 6 two times do not break yarn turn start the edging edging note since at this stage you are holding the top upside down the left cup is on your right and the right cup is on the left i wrote this remark so as not to confuse left and right cups in further text st single_crochet in 1 st ch3 sk1 single_crochet in next st repeat to the end of row finish with a single_crochet in the last st do not turn continue edging all around the top in corners of the cups do ch3 double_crochet ch3 double_crochet at the end of this round cut
